Answer: You might find some insight in the pages of the book of Enoch. Jesus and Jude both quote the book of Enoch, and I’m not sure why the early church fathers left it out… probably too bizarre to believe. But as more and more things are discovered around the world (megalithic structures, and all the weirdness that goes along with them) you simply HAVE to start re examining the narrative of “stone age, then copper age, then iron age,” etc.With that said, I would imagine the wars fought back then were like nothing we can imagine. And that’s about all I can say.

Answer: In 2003 I was working for Cisco Systems and at the time we learned that the US Department of Defense had worked with Intel and other chip manufacturers to install in their hardware the ability to remotely disable any device using their technology with a certain radio frequency. Supposedly, this technology was used to help cripple the Iraqi air defense system when the US invaded.This was important to Cisco because we were working in security and cryptography and the NSA was forever trying to get us to corrupt our products so they could un-encrypt foreign transmissions on the fly. One time we weIn 2003 I was working for Cisco Systems and at the time we learned that the US Department of Defense had worked with Intel and other chip manufacturers to install in their hardware the ability to remotely disable any device using their technology with a certain radio frequency. Supposedly, this technology was used to help cripple the Iraqi air defense system when the US invaded.This was important to Cisco because we were working in security and cryptography and the NSA was forever trying to get us to corrupt our products so they could un-encrypt foreign transmissions on the fly. One time we were required to corrupt product that had been shipped to China and it started a major debate about our fiduciary responsibility to the country or to the customer. The issue was that if you sell a security product that you know is corrupted, you are knowingly committing fraud and are liable. As the Product Manager at the time I asked the NSA if they would stand behind us (and me as I might be personally liable) in court if we were discovered. Of course the answer from the NSA was “Hell no.”We were on our own. We then entered into a long debate about how to detect Easter eggs and other corruption introduced into security products unknowingly through another vendor’s corrupted hardware. The issue was never resolved but it should be known that our security source code HAD to be provided to the NSA in order to get FIPS certification and they made certain changes to it.So to answer your question, USA military technology is advanced far beyond anyone’s knowledge to describe the extent.On the other hand, the Chinese probably know more about our technology than we do since they perpetrated the greatest security breach in history by compromising the RSA key technology used by almost everyone in the world. We only learned of it through the vigilance of Lockheed-Martin who discovered the breach accidentally. But for months the Chinese had the key to almost every computer in the world.

Answer: The most simple answer is that American forces are not deployed in any large numbers on Saudi soil. The defense of the KSA and its oil facilities is the responsibility of Riyadh, not Washington DC.Aside from a small training contingent, the US does not want to deploy forces on Saudi soil bc it encourages Saudi radicals who view any foreign presence to be a blasphemy against their understanding of Islam. The Saudi and American governments know this, so, barring a threat of invasion, you won’t find that presence at that level.

This invention could remove language barriers and make travelling - and doing business with other cultures – much easier. With these earbuds, someone could be standing in front of you speaking French, and the earbuds will feed you the English translation. You can then hold down your right earbud and speak in English, and your phone will project the French translation from the Pixel's speaker, so the other person can hear. The earbuds can translate 40 different languages!

Answer: American and Russian space technology back in the 1960s was surprisingly advanced; think about it: they went out into space without on-board computers. Computers back then were huge, bulky and hot…they were not getting off the ground. Worse, the dumbest, cheapest, dollar-store calculator you can buy today was orders of magnitude more powerful than the best computers of that time.Do you remember that scene from the movie Apollo 13 (1995) where Jim Lovell was calculating something—I can’t remember exactly what right now, but it might have been how much fuel he could burn on re-entry, when, and fAmerican and Russian space technology back in the 1960s was surprisingly advanced; think about it: they went out into space without on-board computers. Computers back then were huge, bulky and hot…they were not getting off the ground. Worse, the dumbest, cheapest, dollar-store calculator you can buy today was orders of magnitude more powerful than the best computers of that time.Do you remember that scene from the movie Apollo 13 (1995) where Jim Lovell was calculating something—I can’t remember exactly what right now, but it might have been how much fuel he could burn on re-entry, when, and for how long—he was doing that with a slide rule. A slide rule! Astounding!
